bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Albemarle County was named for William Anne Keppel, second earl of Albemarle and governor of the Virginia colony from 1737 to 1754. It was formed from Goochland County in 1744, and part of Louisa County and certain islands in the Fluvanna River, now called the James, were added later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Albemarle County (Va.) Chancery Cause, Alexander Rives, etc. vs. George Paris, Sr., etc., undated. Rives, an attorney, is suing for fees for representing Ann Paris in a case, circa 1854, against against her husband, George Paris. George Paris was accused of unlawfully seizing and selling slaves to whom his wife Ann had exclusive rights, by terms of her father's will.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Photocopy; the original case is filed with Albemarle County Chancery, case number 1111-012, at the Library of Virginia.
